attributes.comment:
I am an adoptive parent of a child from China. As we all know, China adoptions
have slowed down considerably. As I move forward with my second adoption, i am
frustrated with the wait times also. As much as we parents are pushing the
agencies to push the government to get the adoptions done before the I600A form
is expired, I feel that we should not be penalized. If you need to raise the cost,
that might be understandable, but, then the time frame should change for
expiration, or there needs to be a discounted cost for reapplication. Thanks for
hearing the voices of adoptive parents!
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Ellen Rathke
